item.title: Bigger ideas & better skills: What we all took home from SRCCON:LEAD
item.description: The third in our series of smaller, thematic SRCCONs gave us a chance to reimagine leadership in journalism and share skills to change our newsrooms.

item.title: A Peer Data Review experiment to bridge a support gap, not a skills gap
item.description: We organized a monthlong pilot program that matched journalists with peer coaches to help them work through questions on a data story. Twelve projects later, here's what we learned.

item.title: A plan for collective support, from SRCCON:LEAD
item.description: In closing out two days about how we can collectively work for change, we shared an invitation to join OpenNews as a founding sustainer.

item.title: SRCCON:LEAD: Reshape the ways journalism leadership operates
item.description: On November 19 & 20, we'll be back in Philly with 125 community members who want to shape the future of leadership in journalism.

item.title: Peer support for local journalists working on data stories
item.description: Journalists on smaller teams have the skills to tell important stories with data, but not always colleagues they can ask for help. We're launching an experimental program to connect them with community members who can offer feedback that gets more of those stories into the world.

item.title: What it takes to be in community
item.description: With ONA this week and the JOC Slack admins receiving the second ONA Community Award, it's a great chance to reflect on how we create community together.

item.title: Announcing SRCCON:PRODUCT, February 2020 in Philadelphia
item.description: Next year, we'll gather 150 product thinkers for the first conference by, for, and about product and news.

item.title: Celebrating and closing the Knight-Mozilla Fellowship
item.description: Over the course of five years, 33 incredible fellows joined newsrooms to work in the open on tools and projects to help journalism flourish. We're closing the program today.

item.title: More on the Director of Programs position
item.description: We've got answers to some of your questions about this new position with OpenNews.

item.title: SRCCON's back and we've got so much to share
item.description: From the mix of sessions you know and love to a few new ways to connect, we're taking a look at the program mix for this year's conference.
